page.content: delivering bottled milk to the nearby rea, as well as, suppling the Milk Marketing Board. There is a boarding kennels for dogs and 3 horse studs. The population of Hargrave approx. 290 has remained stable for many years with very little new housing, consquently the population has become older and the soical life of the village has declined Knowles Green consists of 4 dwellings with no amenties, relying on Hargrave or Chevington for a shop, post office, church and school. Conclusion: If villages are to survive a limited amount of new housing has to be allowed, either to replace condemned properties or on newly aquired land but care must be taken that the character of the village is not greatly changed and the amentities are adequate, for the increasing population. The nearest doctor is 5 miles away at Barrow.
